chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: Installation and requirements details for J4Schema extension

section.title: Requirements
section.para: J4Schema runs on both Joomla! 1.7 and Joomla! 2.5 . We strongly suggest you to always use the latest Joomla! version, since it patches all the known bugs.
System requirements are less restrictive than Joomla!, so, if you can run the CMS without problems, you shouldn't have any problems with this extension.
J4Schema is integrated with JCE editor, so you need to install and use it as editor for your articles.

section.title: Download
section.para:
You can get the latest version of our extension from the "Download" section of our site. J4Schema package consists in 3 files:
J4Schema component (com_j4schema.zip)
J4Schema cleanup plugin (plg_j4schema_cleanup.zip)
J4Schema JCE plugin (JCE_plg_j4schema.zip)

note.para: You should always use the latest version, since we constantly work on fixing bugs and adding new features.

section.title: Installation
section.para: J4Schema component and cleanup plugin are standard Joomla! extensions, so you can install them as usual with the Joomla! Extension manager. J4Schema JCE plugin is a JCE extension, so you have to install it from its control panel.

section.title: Configuration
section.para:
First of all you need to enabled the content plugin J4Schema cleanup, otherwise microdata attributes will not display correctly.
You have to install this plugin since we're adding some non-standard HTML attributes and, sometimes, JCE editor won't process them in the right way.
For example, when you add the itemscope attribute, JCE will process it as it would be a standard attribute, adding ="". So, you will have this wrong text: itemscope="".
Schema.org dictionary, instead, wants it without any quotes, so we have to manipulate it and eliminate them.
After that, you have to add the J4Schema button on JCE editor. To do that, you have to go in JCE Administration » Edit profile » Features tab and drag&drop the Google button.
As last step, you have to disable the "Cleanup HTML" features, since we're adding non-standard HTML tags, JCE sees them as errors and strips them out from your articles.
You can disable it from JCE Administration » Editor Global Configuration.
